page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY VILLAGES
page.content: Within the town are found the old settlements of Two Waters,( Duae Aquae,) Apsley,( a clearing in the Aspen woods,) and Boxmoor (from Box trees). These villages lie along the sides of the Gade and Bulbourne valleys. Of these areas, Two Waters has, apart from the school and bus garage, disappeared although the settlement dates from the 12th century. With the growth of John Dickinson's paper mill, Apsley expanded along the A41 between the canal and railway. Both Nash Mills and Boxmoor developed along the valley routeway. With the establishment of the New Town in the early 1950s Boxmoor, Apsley, Nash Mills and Two Waters were absorbed into the urban growth which spread along the valley sides from old Hemel Hempstead to link with the village centres.
